   639→- [ ] DMG installs correctly
   640→- [ ] Multi-monitor tiling works
   641→- [ ] Documentation is complete
   642→
   643→---
   644→
   645→## Risk Identification
   646→
   647→| Risk | Likelihood | Impact | Mitigation |
   648→|------|------------|--------|------------|
   649→| Accessibility API limitations with some apps (Electron) | High | Medium | CGWindow fallback, app-specific workarounds |
   650→| Native tab API may not support all features | Medium | High | Fall back to custom tab bar if needed |
   651→| Performance issues with many windows | Medium | Medium | Batch operations, lazy updates |
   652→| macOS version differences in APIs | Medium | Medium | Runtime checks, feature flags |
   653→| Code signing for Accessibility permissions | Low | High | Document manual approval process |
   654→
   655→---
   656→
   657→## Verification Steps
   658→
   659→### Per-Phase Verification
   660→Each phase should pass these checks before proceeding:
   661→1. All exit criteria checked off
   662→2. No crashes in 10-minute usage session
   663→3. Memory usage stable (no leaks)
   664→4. CPU < 5% during normal operation
   665→
   666→### Final Verification
   667→- [ ] Fresh install on clean macOS works
   668→- [ ] All keyboard shortcuts functional
   669→- [ ] Drag-drop tiling works smoothly
   670→- [ ] Stacks create and switch correctly
   671→- [ ] Config changes apply immediately
   672→- [ ] Preferences pane accessible
   673→- [ ] Homebrew install works
   674→- [ ] No Accessibility permission prompts after initial grant
   675→
   676→---
   677→
   678→## Execution Strategy
   679→
   680→**Recommended Approach**: Invoke Sisyphus with parallel agent streams:
   681→
   682→| Stream | Agent | Focus |
   683→|--------|-------|-------|
   684→| A | sisyphus-junior-high | Core engine (Phase 1-2) |
   685→| B | frontend-engineer-high | Overlay UI (Phase 3-4) |
   686→| C | sisyphus-junior | Configuration (Phase 5) |
   687→| D | document-writer | Documentation (ongoing) |
   688→
   689→Streams A and B can run in parallel initially. Stream C starts after Phase 2. Stream D runs throughout.
   690→
   691→---
   692→
   693→## Ready for Execution
   694→
   695→This plan is ready for `/sisyphus` execution. Invoke with:
   696→```
   697→/sisyphus cosmic-apple-tile-v1.md
   698→```
   699→

# COSMIC Apple Tile - Work Plan v1.0

> **Project**: COSMIC Apple Tile
> **Goal**: Bring COSMIC DE's tiling experience to macOS with native Apple aesthetics
> **Created**: 2026-01-17
> **Status**: Ready for Execution

---

## Research Context

This section contains critical research findings from the planning session. **READ THIS FIRST** to understand the design patterns we're replicating.

### COSMIC DE Architecture

COSMIC is Pop!_OS's new Rust-based desktop environment (released with Pop!_OS 24.04 LTS, December 2025).

**Key Repositories:**
- **cosmic-comp** (https://[REDACTED_CREDS]@main entry point
│   │   ├── MenuBar/
│   │   │   ├── MenuBarView.swift
│   │   │   └── StatusItemManager.swift
│   │   └── Preferences/
│   │       ├── PreferencesView.swift
│   │       ├── GeneralTab.swift
│   │       ├── TilingTab.swift
│   │       ├── KeyboardTab.swift
│   │       └── AppRulesTab.swift
│   │
│   ├── TilingEngine/               # Core tiling logic
│   │   ├── LayoutTree/
│   │   │   ├── LayoutNode.swift    # Tree node protocol
│   │   │   ├── SplitNode.swift     # Horizontal/vertical split
│   │   │   ├── StackNode.swift     # Tabbed container
│   │   │   ├── WindowNode.swift    # Leaf node (actual window)
│   │   │   └── LayoutTree.swift    # Tree operations
│   │   ├── Workspace/
│   │   │   ├── Workspace.swift
│   │   │   ├── WorkspaceManager.swift
│   │   │   └── WorkspaceSet.swift  # Per-monitor workspaces
│   │   ├── Operations/
│   │   │   ├── TileOperation.swift
│   │   │   ├── MoveOperation.swift
│   │   │   ├── ResizeOperation.swift
│   │   │   └── StackOperation.swift
│   │   └── TilingEngine.swift      # Main engine coordinator
│   │
│   ├── WindowManager/              # macOS window integration
│   │   ├── WindowTracker.swift     # Track all windows
│   │   ├── WindowElement.swift     # Window abstraction
│   │   ├── AccessibilityBridge.swift # AXUIElement wrapper
│   │   ├── CGWindowBridge.swift    # CGWindowList fallback
│   │   └── WindowObserver.swift    # Window create/destroy events
│   │
│   ├── Overlay/                    # Visual drop zones
│   │   ├── OverlayWindow.swift     # Transparent overlay
│   │   ├── DropZoneView.swift      # Visual drop indicators
│   │   ├── SplitIndicator.swift    # Edge split preview
│   │   ├── StackIndicator.swift    # Center stack preview
│   │   ├── PillMarker.swift        # Between-window markers
│   │   └── GlassEffect.swift       # Liquid glass aesthetic
│   │
│   ├── Input/                      # Keyboard & mouse handling
│   │   ├── HotkeyManager.swift     # Global hotkey registration
│   │   ├── MouseTracker.swift      # Mouse position & drag
│   │   ├── DragDropController.swift # Coordinate drag operations
│   │   └── KeyboardShortcuts.swift # Shortcut definitions
│   │
│   ├── Configuration/              # Config system
│   │   ├── Config.swift            # Main config struct
│   │   ├── ConfigStore.swift       # Source of truth
│   │   ├── TOMLParser.swift        # TOML ↔ Config
│   │   ├── ConfigDSL.swift         # Swift DSL
│   │   ├── ConfigSync.swift        # GUI ↔ File sync
│   │   └── DefaultConfig.swift     # Built-in defaults
│   │
│   └── Utilities/
│       ├── Geometry.swift          # CGRect extensions
│       ├── Animation.swift         # Smooth animations
│       └── Logger.swift            # Logging utilities
│
├── Tests/

│   └── Localizable.strings
│

    │   └── cosmic-apple-tile.rb    # Homebrew formula
    └── DMG/
        └── dmg-config.json         # create-dmg config
```

---

## Implementation Phases

### Phase 1: Foundation (Core Engine + Basic Window Management)
**Estimated Files**: 15
**Agents**: sisyphus-junior-high (complex), sisyphus-junior (standard)

#### Tasks:
1. **Setup Swift Package** - Create Package.swift with dependencies (TOMLKit, etc.)
2. **Window Tracking Layer**
   - `WindowElement.swift` - Abstract window representation
   - `AccessibilityBridge.swift` - AXUIElement wrapper for move/resize
   - `CGWindowBridge.swift` - CGWindowList for fast queries
   - `WindowTracker.swift` - Track all windows, observe create/destroy
   - `WindowObserver.swift` - NSWorkspace notifications
3. **Layout Tree Core**
   - `LayoutNode.swift` - Protocol for tree nodes
   - `SplitNode.swift` - Binary split container
   - `WindowNode.swift` - Leaf node wrapping WindowElement
   - `LayoutTree.swift` - Tree manipulation (insert, remove, find)
4. **Basic Tiling Engine**
   - `TilingEngine.swift` - Coordinate layout and window management
   - `TileOperation.swift` - Apply layout to actual windows
5. **Minimal App Shell**
   - `App.swift` - Basic SwiftUI app with menu bar
   - `MenuBarView.swift` - Simple status menu

**Exit Criteria**:
- [ ] App launches and shows menu bar icon
- [ ] Windows are tracked as they open/close
- [ ] Basic tree layout can be constructed programmatically
- [ ] Windows can be moved/resized via Accessibility API

---

### Phase 2: Keyboard Tiling
**Estimated Files**: 8
**Agents**: sisyphus-junior

#### Tasks:
1. **Hotkey System**
   - `HotkeyManager.swift` - Register global hotkeys
   - `KeyboardShortcuts.swift` - Default shortcut definitions
2. **Navigation Operations**
   - `MoveOperation.swift` - Move focus/window in direction
3. **Workspace Foundation**
   - `Workspace.swift` - Single workspace state
   - `WorkspaceManager.swift` - Multiple workspace handling
4. **Basic Config**
   - `Config.swift` - Configuration data model
   - `DefaultConfig.swift` - Built-in defaults
   - `TOMLParser.swift` - Load/save TOML

**Exit Criteria**:
- [ ] Alt+HJKL navigates focus between windows
- [ ] Alt+Shift+HJKL moves windows
- [ ] Alt+1-9 switches workspaces
- [ ] Config loads from ~/.config/cosmic-apple-tile/config.toml

---

### Phase 3: Drag and Drop with Visual Overlays
**Estimated Files**: 10
**Agents**: frontend-engineer-high (UI), sisyphus-junior (logic)

#### Tasks:
1. **Mouse Tracking**
   - `MouseTracker.swift` - Track mouse position, detect drags
   - `DragDropController.swift` - Coordinate drag state machine
2. **Overlay System**
   - `OverlayWindow.swift` - Borderless transparent NSWindow
   - `GlassEffect.swift` - Liquid glass material (NSVisualEffectView)
   - `DropZoneView.swift` - SwiftUI view for drop zones
   - `SplitIndicator.swift` - Edge split preview
   - `StackIndicator.swift` - Center stack preview
   - `PillMarker.swift` - Between-window insertion markers
3. **Drag Logic Integration**
   - Connect drag events to overlay display
   - Implement drop zone hit testing
   - Apply tiling operation on drop

**Exit Criteria**:
- [ ] Dragging window shows zoom-out effect
- [ ] Drop zones appear with glassy Apple aesthetic
- [ ] Dropping on edge creates split
- [ ] Dropping on center creates stack
- [ ] 60fps smooth animations

---

### Phase 4: Stacks (Native Tab Bar)
**Estimated Files**: 5
**Agents**: frontend-engineer (UI), sisyphus-junior (integration)

#### Tasks:
1. **Stack Node Enhancement**
   - `StackNode.swift` - Enhanced with tab management
   - `StackOperation.swift` - Add/remove from stack
2. **Native Tab Integration**
   - Research NSWindow tab API (window.addTabbedWindow)
   - Implement tab bar rendering
   - Handle tab switching
3. **Keyboard Stack Navigation**
   - Add shortcuts for next/prev tab
   - Add shortcut to unstack window

**Exit Criteria**:
- [ ] Stacked windows show native macOS tab bar
- [ ] Clicking tabs switches active window
- [ ] Keyboard can navigate and unstack
- [ ] Drag window out of stack to unstack

---

### Phase 5: Configuration System
**Estimated Files**: 6
**Agents**: sisyphus-junior

#### Tasks:
1. **Swift DSL**
   - `ConfigDSL.swift` - Builder pattern for config
2. **Config Store**
   - `ConfigStore.swift` - Observable source of truth
   - `ConfigSync.swift` - File watching, bidirectional sync
3. **Preferences UI**
   - `PreferencesView.swift` - Main preferences window
   - `GeneralTab.swift`, `TilingTab.swift`, `KeyboardTab.swift`, `AppRulesTab.swift`

**Exit Criteria**:
- [ ] TOML changes reflect in app immediately
- [ ] GUI changes write back to TOML
- [ ] Swift DSL can construct equivalent config
- [ ] Preferences accessible from menu bar

---

### Phase 6: System Preferences Pane
**Estimated Files**: 4
**Agents**: frontend-engineer

#### Tasks:
1. Create PreferencePane target
2. Implement as PrefPane bundle
3. IPC with main app (XPC or Distributed Notifications)
4. Install into System Preferences

**Exit Criteria**:
- [ ] Pane appears in System Preferences
- [ ] Changes sync with main app
- [ ] Apple design guidelines followed

---

### Phase 7: Polish & Distribution
**Estimated Files**: 5
**Agents**: sisyphus-junior, document-writer

#### Tasks:
1. **Multi-monitor Support**
   - `WorkspaceSet.swift` - Per-monitor workspace collections
2. **App Rules**
   - Pattern matching for app-specific behavior
3. **Distribution**
   - `cosmic-apple-tile.rb` - Homebrew formula
   - DMG creation with create-dmg
4. **Documentation**
   - README with installation, config reference
   - Man page

**Exit Criteria**:
- [ ] `brew install cosmic-apple-tile` works
- [ ] DMG installs correctly
- [ ] Multi-monitor tiling works
- [ ] Documentation is complete

---

## Risk Identification

| Risk | Likelihood | Impact | Mitigation |
|------|------------|--------|------------|
| Accessibility API limitations with some apps (Electron) | High | Medium | CGWindow fallback, app-specific workarounds |
| Native tab API may not support all features | Medium | High | Fall back to custom tab bar if needed |
| Performance issues with many windows | Medium | Medium | Batch operations, lazy updates |
| macOS version differences in APIs | Medium | Medium | Runtime checks, feature flags |
| Code signing for Accessibility permissions | Low | High | Document manual approval process |

---

## Verification Steps

### Per-Phase Verification
Each phase should pass these checks before proceeding:
1. All exit criteria checked off
2. No crashes in 10-minute usage session
3. Memory usage stable (no leaks)
4. CPU < 5% during normal operation

### Final Verification
- [ ] Fresh install on clean macOS works
- [ ] All keyboard shortcuts functional
- [ ] Drag-drop tiling works smoothly
- [ ] Stacks create and switch correctly
- [ ] Config changes apply immediately
- [ ] Preferences pane accessible
- [ ] Homebrew install works
- [ ] No Accessibility permission prompts after initial grant

---

## Execution Strategy

**Recommended Approach**: Invoke Sisyphus with parallel agent streams:

| Stream | Agent | Focus |
|--------|-------|-------|
| A | sisyphus-junior-high | Core engine (Phase 1-2) |
| B | frontend-engineer-high | Overlay UI (Phase 3-4) |
| C | sisyphus-junior | Configuration (Phase 5) |
| D | document-writer | Documentation (ongoing) |

Streams A and B can run in parallel initially. Stream C starts after Phase 2. Stream D runs throughout.

---

## Ready for Execution

This plan is ready for `/sisyphus` execution. Invoke with:
```
/sisyphus cosmic-apple-tile-v1.md
```

Or start with Phase 1 manually and iterate.

1→import Foundation
     2→
     3→// MARK: - Direction
     4→
     5→/// Represents a cardinal direction for navigation and operations
     6→public enum Direction: CaseIterable, Sendable {
     7→    case up, down, left, right
     8→
     9→    /// The opposite direction
    10→    public var opposite: Direction {
    11→        switch self {
    12→        case .up: return .down
    13→        case .down: return .up
    14→        case .left: return .right
    15→        case .right: return .left
    16→        }
    17→    }
    18→
    19→    /// Whether this is a horizontal direction (left/right)
    20→    public var isHorizontal: Bool {
    21→        self == .left || self == .right
    22→    }
    23→
    24→    /// Whether this is a vertical direction (up/down)
    25→    public var isVertical: Bool {
    26→        self == .up || self == .down
    27→    }
    28→}
    29→
    30→// MARK: - Split Direction
    31→
    32→/// Direction of a split in the layout tree
    33→public enum SplitDirection: String, Codable, Sendable {
    34→    case horizontal  // Children are arranged left-to-right
    35→    case vertical    // Children are arranged top-to-bottom
    36→
    37→    /// Toggle between horizontal and vertical
    38→    public var toggled: SplitDirection {
    39→        self == .horizontal ? .vertical : .horizontal
    40→    }
    41→}
    42→
    43→// MARK: - CGRect Extensions
    44→
    45→extension CGRect {
    46→    /// The center point of the rectangle
    47→    public var center: CGPoint {
    48→        CGPoint(x: midX, y: midY)
    49→    }
    50→
    51→    /// Split this rectangle into two parts
    52→    /// - Parameters:
    53→    ///   - direction: Whether to split horizontally or vertically
    54→    ///   - ratio: The ratio (0.0-1.0) determining the split point
    55→    /// - Returns: A tuple of two rectangles (first, second)
    56→    public func split(_ direction: SplitDirection, ratio: CGFloat = 0.5) -> (first: CGRect, second: CGRect) {
    57→        let clampedRatio = max(0.0, min(1.0, ratio))
    58→
    59→        switch direction {
    60→        case .horizontal:
    61→            let splitX = origin.x + width * clampedRatio
    62→            let first = CGRect(x: origin.x, y: origin.y, width: width * clampedRatio, height: height)
    63→            let second = CGRect(x: splitX, y: origin.y, width: width * (1 - clampedRatio), height: height)
    64→            return (first, second)
    65→
    66→        case .vertical:
    67→            let splitY = origin.y + height * clampedRatio
    68→            let first = CGRect(x: origin.x, y: origin.y, width: width, height: height * clampedRatio)
    69→            let second = CGRect(x: origin.x, y: splitY, width: width, height: height * (1 - clampedRatio))
    70→            return (first, second)
    71→        }
    72→    }
    73→
    74→    /// Create a new rectangle expanded by the given insets
    75→    public func expanded(by insets: EdgeInsets) -> CGRect {
    76→        CGRect(
    77→            x: origin.x - insets.left,
    78→            y: origin.y - insets.top,
    79→            width: width + insets.left + insets.right,
    80→            height: height + insets.top + insets.bottom
    81→        )
    82→    }
    83→
    84→    /// Create a new rectangle contracted by the given insets
    85→    public func contracted(by insets: EdgeInsets) -> CGRect {
    86→        CGRect(
    87→            x: origin.x + insets.left,
    88→            y: origin.y + insets.top,
    89→            width: max(0, width - insets.left - insets.right),
    90→            height: max(0, height - insets.top - insets.bottom)
    91→        )
    92→    }
    93→
    94→    /// Create a new rectangle with uniform padding
    95→    public func inset(by padding: CGFloat) -> CGRect {
    96→        insetBy(dx: padding, dy: padding)
    97→    }
    98→
    99→    /// Check if this rectangle is adjacent to another in the given direction
   100→    public func isAdjacent(to other: CGRect, direction: Direction, tolerance: CGFloat = 1.0) -> Bool {
   101→        switch direction {
   102→        case .left:
   103→            return abs(minX - other.maxX) <= tolerance &&
   104→                   maxY > other.minY && minY < other.maxY
   105→        case .right:
   106→            return abs(maxX - other.minX) <= tolerance &&
   107→                   maxY > other.minY && minY < other.maxY
   108→        case .up:
   109→            return abs(minY - other.maxY) <= tolerance &&
   110→                   maxX > other.minX && minX < other.maxX
   111→        case .down:
   112→            return abs(maxY - other.minY) <= tolerance &&
   113→                   maxX > other.minX && minX < other.maxX
   114→        }
   115→    }
   116→}
   117→
   118→// MARK: - EdgeInsets
   119→
   120→/// Edge insets for padding/gaps
   121→public struct EdgeInsets: Equatable, Codable, Sendable {
   122→    public var top: CGFloat
   123→    public var left: CGFloat
   124→    public var bottom: CGFloat
   125→    public var right: CGFloat
   126→
   127→    public init(top: CGFloat = 0, left: CGFloat = 0, bottom: CGFloat = 0, right: CGFloat = 0) {
   128→        self.top = top
   129→        self.left = left
   130→        self.bottom = bottom
   131→        self.right = right
   132→    }
   133→
   134→    /// Create uniform insets
   135→    public init(all: CGFloat) {
   136→        self.top = all
   137→        self.left = all
   138→        self.bottom = all
   139→        self.right = all
   140→    }
   141→
   142→    /// Create horizontal and vertical insets
   143→    public init(horizontal: CGFloat, vertical: CGFloat) {
   144→        self.top = vertical
   145→        self.left = horizontal
   146→        self.bottom = vertical
   147→        self.right = horizontal
   148→    }
   149→
   150→    /// Zero insets
   151→    public static let zero = EdgeInsets()
   152→}
   153→
   154→// MARK: - CGPoint Extensions
   155→
   156→extension CGPoint {
   157→    /// Distance to another point
   158→    public func distance(to other: CGPoint) -> CGFloat {
   159→        let dx = x - other.x
   160→        let dy = y - other.y
   161→        return sqrt(dx * dx + dy * dy)
   162→    }
   163→
   164→    /// The direction from this point to another
   165→    public func direction(to other: CGPoint) -> Direction? {
   166→        let dx = other.x - x
   167→        let dy = other.y - y
   168→
   169→        if abs(dx) > abs(dy) {
   170→            return dx > 0 ? .right : .left
   171→        } else if abs(dy) > abs(dx) {
   172→            return dy > 0 ? .down : .up
   173→        }
   174→        return nil
   175→    }
   176→}
   177→
   178→// MARK: - CGSize Extensions
   179→
   180→extension CGSize {
   181→    /// The aspect ratio (width / height)
   182→    public var aspectRatio: CGFloat {
   183→        guard height > 0 else { return 0 }
   184→        return width / height
   185→    }
   186→
   187→    /// Whether this is a landscape size
   188→    public var isLandscape: Bool {
   189→        width > height
   190→    }
   191→
   192→    /// Whether this is a portrait size
   193→    public var isPortrait: Bool {
   194→        height > width
   195→    }
   196→}
   197→
